metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4324 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
spice-gtk 0.14, and possibly other versions, invokes the polkit authority using the insecure polkit_unix_process_new API function, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions by leveraging a PolkitUnixProcess PolkitSubject race condition via a (1) setuid process or (2) pkexec process, a related issue to CVE-2013-4288.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-spice-client-glib-2.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
gir1.2-spice-client-gtk-2.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
gir1.2-spice-client-gtk-3.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-glib-2.0-8 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-gtk-2.0-4 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-gtk-3.0-4 - 0.22-0nocent2
python-spice-client-gtk - 0.22-0nocent2
spice-client-glib-usb-acl-helper - 0.22-0nocent2
spice-client-gtk - 0.22-0nocent2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice-gtk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.22-0nocent2').
